sections.title: Why build a custom productivity app?
sections.content:
The landscape of project management tools is vast, yet many teams find themselves compromisingbetween features, speed, and cost. Off-the-shelf solutions often come with bloated interfaces, slow performance, or prohibitive subscription models, forcing teams to adapt their refined workflows to the tool's limitations.

Imagine a tool that's not just fast, but built precisely for your team's unique rhythm. A tool that prioritizes keyboard shortcuts, intelligent workflows, and a clean interface, without the unnecessary clutter. With Kliv, you can now build that perfect productivity hub, owning your data and your development destiny.

sections.title: The case for a bespoke Linear-style tool
sections.content:
## The frustrations of generic productivity suites
Existing project and issue trackers often present several challenges:

- **Performance bottlenecks**: Many web-based tools can feel sluggish, interrupting flow.
- **Feature bloat**: Overwhelming UIs with features you don't need, making core tasks harder.
- **Cost scalability**: Monthly per-user fees can become expensive as your team grows.
- **Lack of flexibility**: Inability to deeply customize workflows, fields, or integrations.
- **Data privacy concerns**: Relying on third-party servers for sensitive project data.

## Why custom-built excels
By leveraging Kliv's AI platform, building your own tool addresses these pain points directly:

### Blazing fast performance
Design your tool to be inherently performant, optimizing for speed and responsiveness. This means quicker issue creation, faster searches, and seamless navigation that keeps your team in flow.

### Tailored workflows
No more trying to fit a square peg in a round hole. Define custom states, transitions, fields, and automation rules that perfectly mirror your team's agile, scrum, or kanban methodologies.

### Cost efficiency
Invest once in a custom solution, rather than paying perpetual subscription fees that scale with your team size. This provides significant long-term savings.

### Complete UI/UX control
Craft an interface that's genuinely intuitive for your users. Emphasize minimalism, keyboard navigation, and intelligent commands that reduce clicks and mental overhead.

### Data ownership & security
Host your application and data on your own infrastructure or a cloud provider of your choice, ensuring maximum security and compliance with your data governance policies.

## Real-world applications
A custom Linear-like application is ideal for:

- **Software Development Teams**: Streamline bug tracking, feature development, and sprint planning with a tool that truly understands software workflows.
- **Product Management**: Manage product roadmaps, user stories, and feedback loops with deeply integrated planning capabilities.
- **Creative Agencies**: Track design tasks, content creation, and client feedback with visual and collaborative features.
- **Internal Operations**: Manage internal requests, IT tickets, and cross-departmental projects with a centralized, rapid-response system.

## The AI acceleration
Building sophisticated applications used to be a long, arduous process. Kliv's AI changes this:

- **Natural Language Design**: Describe your ideal feature, and watch the AI generate the foundation.
- **Iterative Development**: Quickly prototype, test, and refine features based on real-time feedback.
- **Code Generation**: AI assists in generating clean, maintainable code for your application.
- **Automated Deployments**: Go from idea to live application faster than ever before.

Build the productivity tool you've always wanted, without compromise.

sections.title: Frequently Asked Questions about building with Kliv

items.answer: Building a basic Linear-like application on Kliv can take as little as a few hours for core functionality. More complex features like advanced integrations or detailed reporting can extend development to a few days or weeks.
items.question: How quickly can I build a custom productivity app?

items.answer: No coding expertise is needed. Kliv's platform allows you to describe your desired application using natural language, and the AI assists in generating the necessary code and components. It's a low-code/no-code approach powered by AI.
items.question: Is coding knowledge required to build this type of app?

items.answer: Yes, your custom application can integrate with almost any third-party service that exposes an API. This includes version control systems like GitHub, communication tools like Slack, or other project management suites.
items.question: Can my custom app integrate with existing tools like GitHub or Slack?

items.answer: When you build with Kliv, you own 100% of the code and the intellectual property. You decide where your data is stored, giving you complete control over security and privacy, unlike subscribing to a SaaS product.
items.question: Who owns the data and code created with Kliv?

items.answer: In the long run, building a custom solution is often more cost-effective. While SaaS products charge recurring per-user fees that increase with your team size, a Kliv-built app is a one-time investment with minimal ongoing hosting costs.
items.question: How does the cost compare to off-the-shelf solutions?

items.answer: Absolutely. One of the primary advantages of building with Kliv is the ability to continuously evolve your application. You can add new features, modify existing workflows, and scale the application as your team's needs change.
items.question: Can I modify or expand the application after it's initially built?

items.answer: Yes, custom-built applications can be highly secure because you control the hosting environment, security protocols, and who has access. You're not relying on a third-party vendor's security practices, which can be a significant advantage for sensitive data.
